## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I have a Lite wallet address and I want to import it into my native Verus Desktop, but I don't have a running native wallet. Is there a way to do this?

**AI Assistant:**
Unfortunately, you can't import your Lite wallet address into your native Verus Desktop without a running native wallet. You need to have a running native wallet first, which is fully synchronized, to convert your seedphrase into a Private key (WIF). The earliest wallet that supports these functions is Verus Desktop v0.6.4-beta-1. If you don't have a running native wallet, you can follow the instructions to quickly synchronize your wallet.

**User:**
Okay, got it. So I just need to use any version of Verus Desktop to convert my seedphrase into a Private key (WIF), right?

**AI Assistant:**
No, that's not correct. You cannot use any version of Verus Desktop to convert your seedphrase into a Private key (WIF). The earliest wallet that supports these functions is **Verus Desktop v0.6.4-beta-1**. You need to use at least this version or later to convert your seedphrase. Make sure you're using the correct version to avoid any issues.
How can I import my Lite wallet address into my native Verus Desktop without a running native wallet?

You can't import your Lite wallet address into your native Verus Desktop without a running native wallet. You need to have a running native wallet first, which is fully synchronized, to convert your seedphrase into a Private key (WIF). The earliest wallet that supports these functions is Verus Desktop v0.6.4-beta-1. If you don't have a running native wallet, you can follow the instructions to quickly synchronize your wallet.

# How to import your Lite wallet address into your native Verus Desktop?Attention: Read it completely before using.### Important General Information`verus command "<userinput>"` needs to be entered literally, with `<userinput>` replaced by your specific userdata. So if the text directs you to use for example `"<Public Address>"`, you replace that (including the `<` and `>`) with the address,
so it looks similar to this: `"RYX6RYU3AAvwVCNyNM4cVyGUhSMUPvKs3r"`.This method is confirmed to work on Verus and all Komodo assetchains.## PrerequisitesIn order to convert your seedphrase into a Private key (WIF), you need to have a running native wallet first, that is fully synchronized. The earliest wallet that supports these functions is **Verus Desktop v0.6.4-beta-1**.If needed, use this guide to quickly synchronize your wallet: https://wiki.verus.io/#!how-to/how-to_bootstrap.md## Converting Seed to WIF
If you have a seed, you can retrieve your Private key (WIF) by having the Verus Desktop wallet convert it for you.
To convert your *seed phrase* in Verus Desktop, go to `settings` --> `Coin Settings`, select the chain you want to use in the top-right corner and enter the following command:
```
run convertpassphrase "word_1 word_2 word_3 ... word_n"
```Note: Make sure you replace `Word1 word2 word3 ... word_n` with the actual seedphrase (12 or 24 words) of the address you want to import!
Can I use any version of Verus Desktop to convert my seedphrase into a Private key (WIF)?

No, you cannot use any version of Verus Desktop to convert your seedphrase into a Private key (WIF). The earliest wallet that supports these functions is **Verus Desktop v0.6.4-beta-1**. You need to use at least this version or later to convert your seedphrase.
